## More info

This comprehensive textbook provides an in-depth exploration of spatial analysis methods and their practical applications in geographic information systems. It bridges the gap between theoretical concepts and real-world implementation, making it an essential resource for students, researchers, and professionals working with spatial data.

The book covers a wide range of spatial analysis techniques, from fundamental concepts to advanced methods, with clear explanations, practical examples, and hands-on exercises using popular GIS software.

Key topics include:
- Fundamentals of spatial analysis
- Spatial data models and structures
- Spatial statistics and geostatistics
- Point pattern analysis
- Spatial autocorrelation and regression
- Network analysis and routing
- Surface analysis and terrain modeling
- Spatial interpolation techniques
- Geographically weighted regression
- Spatial decision support systems
- Big data and spatial analysis
- Case studies and practical applications
- Emerging trends in spatial analysis
